page.title: 17BUCKLAND CHURCH AND HALL
page.content: {1745}Royal Coat of Arms over South door.There are telegrams to George VI and Elizabeth II for their Coronations and Silver Jubilees with replies.The oil lamps have been converted to electricity.The Visitors'Book records about 4,000 names a month in summer. We recorded our names on{July 8th. {1985.}To the South of the church is a separate thatched vestry. A Community Hall was opened in August 1985 by F.Marks,Teignbridge vice-chairman.It was blessed by the Rev.Treneer. Built to National Park regulations it cost Â£29,000,Â£7,000 raised by residents,the rest from grants.Local children were presented with special mugs.The Hall will be used for social occasions and the Parish Meeting which is held twice a year.Discussions usually centre on how to keep National Park rules.
